Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Partial and Circumferential Stapled Hemorrhoidopexy

Participants.evidence: 300 patients with grade III/IV hemorrhoids were recruited between August 2011 and November 2013

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned in a 1:1 ratio to receive either PSH (n = 150) or CSH (n = 150)

Objective.evidence: The long-term outcomes of partial stapled hemorrhoidopexy (PSH) versus circumferential stapled hemorrhoidopexy (CSH) for grade III/IV hemorrhoids remain unclear.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of recurrent prolapse at a median follow-up of 5 years

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: blocked randomisation with a fixed block size of 4. Allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Patients and outcome assessors were blinded to the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 300 patients with grade III/IV hemorrhoids were recruited between August 2011 and November 2013

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 5-year cumulative recurrence rate was 9% (95% CI, 4%–13%) for PSH and 12% (95% CI, 7%–17%) for CSH (p = 0.137)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were minimal, with no rectovaginal fistulas reported.
